content: 1 Paul, a prisoner of Christ Jesus, and Timotheus the brother, to Philemon our beloved and fellow-worker,
content_old: 1 Paul, a prisoner of Christ Jesus, and Timotheus the brother, to Philemon our beloved and fellow-worker,

content: 2 and Apphia the beloved, and Archippus our fellow-soldier, and the assembly in thy house:
content_old: 2 and Apphia the beloved, and Archippus our fellow-soldier, and the assembly in thy house:

content: 3 Grace to you, and peace, from God our Father, and the Lord Jesus Christ!
content_old: 3 Grace to you, and peace, from God our Father, and the Lord Jesus Christ!

content: 4 I give thanks to my God, always making mention of thee in my prayers,
content_old: 4 I give thanks to my God, always making mention of thee in my prayers,

content: 5 hearing of thy love and faith that thou hast unto the Lord Jesus and toward all the saints,
content_old: 5 hearing of thy love and faith that thou hast unto the Lord Jesus and toward all the saints,

content: 6 that the fellowship of thy faith may become working in the full knowledge of every good thing that is in you toward Christ Jesus;
content_old: 6 that the fellowship of thy faith may become working in the full knowledge of every good thing that is in you toward Christ Jesus;

content: 7 for we have much joy and comfort in thy love, because the bowels of the saints have been refreshed through thee, brother.
content_old: 7 for we have much joy and comfort in thy love, because the bowels of the saints have been refreshed through thee, brother.

content: 8 Wherefore, having in Christ much boldness to command thee that which is fit—
content_old: 8 Wherefore, having in Christ much boldness to command thee that which is fit—

content: 9 because of the love I rather entreat, being such an one as Paul the aged, and now also a prisoner of Jesus Christ;
content_old: 9 because of the love I rather entreat, being such an one as Paul the aged, and now also a prisoner of Jesus Christ;

content: 10 I entreat thee concerning my child—whom I did beget in my bonds—Onesimus,
content_old: 10 I entreat thee concerning my child—whom I did beget in my bonds—Onesimus,

content: 11 who once was to thee unprofitable, and now is profitable to me and to thee,
content_old: 11 who once was to thee unprofitable, and now is profitable to me and to thee,

content: 12 whom I did send again, and thou him (that is, my own bowels) receive,
content_old: 12 whom I did send again, and thou him (that is, my own bowels) receive,

content: 13 whom I did wish to retain to myself, that in thy behalf he might minister to me in the bonds of the good news,
content_old: 13 whom I did wish to retain to myself, that in thy behalf he might minister to me in the bonds of the good news,

content: 14 and apart from thy mind I willed to do nothing, that as of necessity thy good deed may not be, but of willingness,
content_old: 14 and apart from thy mind I willed to do nothing, that as of necessity thy good deed may not be, but of willingness,

content: 15 for perhaps because of this he did depart for an hour, that age-duringly thou mayest have him,
content_old: 15 for perhaps because of this he did depart for an hour, that age-duringly thou mayest have him,

content: 16 no more as a servant, but above a servant—a brother beloved, especially to me, and how much more to thee, both in the flesh and in the Lord!
content_old: 16 no more as a servant, but above a servant—a brother beloved, especially to me, and how much more to thee, both in the flesh and in the Lord!

content: 17 If, then, with me thou hast fellowship, receive him as me,
content_old: 17 If, then, with me thou hast fellowship, receive him as me,

content: 18 and if he did hurt to thee, or doth owe anything, this to me be reckoning;
content_old: 18 and if he did hurt to thee, or doth owe anything, this to me be reckoning;

content: 19 I, Paul did write with my hand, I—I will repay; that I may not say that also thyself, besides, to me thou dost owe.
content_old: 19 I, Paul did write with my hand, I—I will repay; that I may not say that also thyself, besides, to me thou dost owe.

content: 20 Yes, brother, may I have profit of thee in the Lord; refresh my bowels in the Lord;
content_old: 20 Yes, brother, may I have profit of thee in the Lord; refresh my bowels in the Lord;

content: 21 having been confident in thy obedience I did write to thee, having known that also above what I may say thou wilt do;
content_old: 21 having been confident in thy obedience I did write to thee, having known that also above what I may say thou wilt do;

content: 22 and at the same time also prepare for me a lodging, for I hope that through your prayers I shall be granted to you.
content_old: 22 and at the same time also prepare for me a lodging, for I hope that through your prayers I shall be granted to you.

content: 23 Salute thee doth Epaphras, (my fellow-captive in Christ Jesus,)
content_old: 23 Salute thee doth Epaphras, (my fellow-captive in Christ Jesus,)

content: 24 Markus, Aristarchus, Demas, Lukas, my fellow-workmen!
content_old: 24 Markus, Aristarchus, Demas, Lukas, my fellow-workmen!
